text.section: The Secretary shall appoint local advisory councils.

Each local advisory council shall consist of:
an equal number of members who represent employees and who represent employers; and
the number of members who represent the general public that the Secretary sets.

Each member of a local advisory council who represents employees or who represents employers shall be regarded as a representative of employees or employers because of affiliation, employment, or vocation.

A member of a local advisory council:
may not receive compensation; but
is entitled to reimbursement for necessary expenses.

The local advisory councils shall help the Secretary to:
develop policies and discuss problems related to the administration of this title; and
ensure impartiality and freedom from political influence in the solution of those problems.
